form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Cassidy introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

form.official-title: To prohibit certain telework employees from receiving certain annual adjustments to pay schedules, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Federal Employee Return to Work Act.

subparagraph.text: means an employee who teleworks not fewer than 1 day, or in the case of an alternative work schedule, not less than 20 percent, a week; and
does not include an employee who—

clause.text: teleworks not fewer than 1 day a week; and

subclause.text: is disabled and receives reasonable accommodations;
a member of the Foreign Service of the United States;
a member of the Armed Forces on active duty; or
any other employee, the official worksite of whom is not described in section 531.605(a)(1) of title 5, Code of Federal Regulations (or any corresponding similar regulation or ruling).

paragraph.text: The term employee has the meaning given the term in section 2105 of title 5, United States Code.
The term telework has the meaning given the term in section 6501 of title 5, United States Code.

section.text: No covered employee may receive an annual adjustment under section 5303 of title 5, United States Code.
Each covered employee shall be paid at the rate of basic pay under the applicable grade and step for that employee under the locality pay area designated as Rest of U.S.—

paragraph.text: as of the date on which the employee becomes a covered employee; and
which shall not be adjusted under section 5304 of title 5, United States Code.

section.text: This Act shall take effect on the first day of the first full fiscal year beginning after the date of enactment of this Act.
